meanings.definition: To reason logically or apply logic to a situation.
meanings.sent1: She tried to logicize the problem by breaking it down into smaller parts.
meanings.sent2: It is important to logicize when solving complex puzzles.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to logicize why the chicken crossed the road, but ended up with more questions than answers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a machine, able to logicize any problem thrown at her.
meanings.sent5: Logicizing the math equation helped her find the correct answer quickly.

meanings.definition: To make logical or rational sense.
meanings.sent1: The story didn't logicize, leaving the readers confused.
meanings.sent2: His explanation finally started to logicize after he provided more details.
meanings.sent3: Trying to logicize why cats chase laser pointers can be quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to logicize the chaos around them, bringing clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The plan began to logicize once they outlined the steps clearly.
